macros.label: Firefight
Blizzard
Snow2
<b>Notes
macros.command:
[r, dialog("Info", "width=550; height=700; input=0; temporary=1; title=Info; noframe=0"):{'
The current crop of overlay effects that work... mostly
Advisory
Some of these work brilliantly, some run like a dog with one leg pushing a wheelbarrow. Some take time to get going, and some seem to start according to some occult formula based on the phase of the moon.
Dependencies
The table "tWeather" is required for effects that use images
(currently "Birds" and "Falling Leaves").
Import it because they are cool.
Usage
The   Red   buttons.
These stop all effects.
The  Green  buttons.
The proper way. Simple but boring
Click a  Green  button.
You are given a list of effects to choose from.
Pick one. Any existing effects will vanish and the new one will start for all connected clients.
The  Silvery White  buttons.
Fun on your own.
You can click these to launch each overlay effect on its own. They don't always cancel previous effects so some of them can be overlapped, e.g. you can have searchlights in the fog.
This only happens on your machine though and does not get seen by other connected clients.
One day I will get bored enough to implement this as a feature.
Some Weirdness Explained
1. When you launch an overlay with the same name as an existing overlay, it does not automatically kill any existing JavaScript that is running.
This is also the case when you close an overlay. This means that your machine can get bogged down running scripts that you can't even see.
This is why the red buttons do a dodgy fix to replace the existing JS with nothing.

2. The Java implementation of HTML5 runs some stuff up to 15 times slower than a browser. You can spend a week making the worlds prettiest animated overlay only to find it runs at 3 frames/second. If you can be bothered optimising and refining the code, please do. Most of these were swiped from the internet and have not been examined for efficiency. '}]

macros.label: Fog
Lightning
localStream
macros.command:
[h:'<!-- ------------------------ localStream(link,repeat,volume,start,stop) ---------------------------->']
<!--
link	- The uri/url of the file. 
repeat	- The number of times the audio should play. If set to 0, the file is cached but not played; if set to -1, the file is played continuously. Defaults to 1.   
volume	- The volume the audio is to be played at. Can range from 0 to 1. Defaults to 1.
start	- The time offset in seconds where audio should start playing, or restart from when repeating. Defaults to 0.
stop	- The time offset where audio should stop playing or restart when repeating. Defaults to the end of the audio.
-->

[h:maxArgs = 5]
[h: assert(argCount(),"At least one argument is required to run "+getMacroName(),0)]
[h: assert(argCount()<=maxArgs,"You have too many arguments, max "+maxArgs+" arguments allowed in "+getMacroName(),0)]

[h, if(argCount() == 1): playStream(arg(0))]
[h, if(argCount() == 2): playStream(arg(0), arg(1))]
[h, if(argCount() == 3): playStream(arg(0), arg(1), arg(2))]
[h, if(argCount() == 4): playStream(arg(0), arg(1), arg(2), arg(3))]
[h, if(argCount() == 5): playStream(arg(0), arg(1), arg(2), arg(3), arg(4))]

macros.label: globalStream
macros.command:
[h:'<!-- ------------------------------- globalStream(link,repeat,volume,start,stop) ------------------>']
<!--
link 	- The uri/url of the file. 
repeat	- The number of times the audio should play. If set to 0, the file is cached but not played; if set to -1, the file is played continuously. Defaults to 1.   
volume	- The volume the audio is to be played at. Can range from 0 to 1. Defaults to 1.
start	- The time offset in seconds where audio should start playing, or restart from when repeating. Defaults to 0.
stop	- The time offset where audio should stop playing or restart when repeating. Defaults to the end of the audio.
-->

[h: maxArgs 	= 5]
[h: nArgs		= argCount()]
[h: assert(nArgs,			"At least one argument is required to run "+getMacroName(),							0)]
[h: assert(nargs <= maxArgs,"You have too many arguments, max "+maxArgs+" arguments allowed in "+getMacroName(),0)]

[h: args 		= "[]"]
[h, for(i, 0, nArgs): args = json.append(args, arg(roll.count))]

[H: audioLink 	= macroLinkText("localStream@"+getMacroLocation(),"none", args)]
[H: execLink(audioLink,1,"all")]

macros.label: dropbox audio link converter
macros.command:
[h,if(argCount()): dlink=arg(0) ; abort(input("dlink|<here>|enter dropbox link"))]
[h: dindex=indexOf(dlink, '?')]
[h, if(dindex!=-1):dlink=substring(dlink, 0, dindex); '']
[r: macro.return=replace(dlink, 'www.dropbox.com', 'dl.dropboxusercontent.com')]
macros.tooltip:
<html><table width=260>
Cleans and alters dropbox links for use as audio URIs
Author: Reverend/Bubblobill/wolph42
Date: 2nd November 2020
</html>

macros.label: stopLocal
macros.command:
[h:'<!------------------ stopLocal(uri, remove, fadeout) ------------------------------>']
<!--
uri		- The uri/url of the stream or clip to stop. If set to "*", all audio stream or clips are stopped. Defaults to "*".
remove	- If set to 1, the audio file is removed from memory. Defaults to 1.
fadeout	- Optional fadeout (in seconds) before stopping the stream or clip. If set to 0, stop as soon as possible. Defaults to 0.
-->

[h:maxArgs = 3]
[h: assert(argCount(),"At least one argument is required to run "+getMacroName(),0)]
[h: assert(argCount()<=maxArgs,"You have too many arguments, max "+maxArgs+" arguments allowed in "+getMacroName(),0)]

[h, if(argCount() == 1): stopSound(arg(0))]
[h, if(argCount() == 2): stopSound(arg(0), arg(1))]
[h, if(argCount() == 3): stopSound(arg(0), arg(1), arg(2))]

macros.label: Version 1.3.2
macros.command:
<pre>
Weather Girl Version 1.3.1

Credits:

Overlay effects: Reverend/Bubblobill
Sounds and some minor tinkering: Wolph42

notes:
The sounds will work out fo the box as they are linked to my dropbox, however I would suggest to create your own links and replace these in the sound macros.

Version 1.0
- first release with version number
- added sounds. 
- made leaf table images smaller

Version 1.1
- added Parade overlay

Version 1.2
- fixed some overlay names
- moved Environment Lighting back to its own macro

Version 1.3
- moved macroLink execution to UDF "runMacro"
- split up into separate overlays mostly based on input groupings
	* fx.Ambience (sfx)
	* fx.Lighting (Environment lighting)
	* fx.Lightning(will change one day to something more generic)
	* fx.Space	  (Space)
	* fx.Surround (Border)
	* fx.Weather  (Actual weather)
- fixed some typos and fiddly bits

Version 1.3.1
- stores previous selection and prepopulates input fields

Version 1.3.2
- updated input to handle more layers

macros.label: Parade
Environment Lighting
weather
macros.command:
[h, if(!isFunctionDefined("runMacro")): defineFunction("runMacro", "runMacro@"+getMacroLocation())] [h: lightValues = getLibProperty("lightValues", getMacroLocation())] [h: lightingOptions = json.fields(lightValues, "json") )] [h: weatherOptions = json.append("", "none", "Drifting Light Rays", "Fog", "Lightning", "Rain", "Rain-Heavy", "Rain-Overhead", "Rainbow", "Blizzard", "Snow", "Snow2", "Thunderstorm" )] [h: sfxOptions = json.append("", "none", "Birds", "Falling Leaves", "Swarm", "Firefight", "Firefront", "Parade", "Gradient Edge", "Smoke", "Stalag-13" )] [h: spaceOptions = json.append("", "none", "Meteor1", "Meteor2", "Meteor3", "Starfield1", "Starfield2" )] [h: soundOptions = json.append("", "none", "Rain Light", "Rain Medium", "Rain Heavy", "Wind Light", "Wind Strong", "Wind Blizard", "Thunderstorm" )] [h: lighting_Options = lightingOptions][h: weather_Options = weatherOptions][h: sfx_Options = sfxOptions][h: space_Options = spaceOptions] [h: json.toVars(lower(getLibProperty("overlaySelection", getMacroLocation())))] [h: idxVars=json.append("", "lighting", "lighting_","weather", "weather_", "sfx", "sfx_", "space", "space_", "sound")] [h, foreach(idx, idxVars): evalMacro(strformat(' [%{idx}Index = max(json.indexOf(lower(%{idx}Options), lower(fx.%{idx})))), 0)] '))] [H: abort(input( "lighting|"+lightingOptions+"|Select a Lighting Effect|LIST|SELECT="+lightingIndex+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "lighting_|"+lightingOptions+"|Select a Lighting Effect|LIST|SELECT="+lighting_Index+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "weather|"+weatherOptions+"|Select Weather Effect|LIST|SELECT="+weatherIndex+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "weather_|"+weatherOptions+"|Select Weather Effect|LIST|SELECT="+weather_Index+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "sfx|"+sfxOptions+"|Select Special Effect|LIST|SELECT="+sfxIndex+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "sfx_|"+sfxOptions+"|Select Special Effect|LIST|SELECT="+sfx_Index+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "space|"+spaceOptions+"|Select Space Effect|LIST|SELECT="+spaceIndex+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "space_|"+spaceOptions+"|Select Space Effect|LIST|SELECT="+space_Index+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON", "junk|SOUNDS:
|-|LABEL|SPAN=TRUE", "sound|"+soundOptions+"|Select ambient sound to play|LIST|SELECT="+soundIndex+" VALUE=STRING DELIMITER=JSON" ))] [h: setLibProperty("overlaySelection", json.set("", "fx.Sfx", sfx, "fx.Sfx_",sfx_, "fx.Lighting", lighting, "fx.Lighting_",lighting_, "fx.Space", space, "fx.Space_", space_, "fx.Surround", "", "fx.Surround_","", "fx.Weather", weather, "fx.Weather_", weather_, "fx.sound", sound), getMacroLocation())] [args=""] [h, if(lighting != "none"): runMacro("Environment Lighting", lighting); runMacro("emptyOverlay", "fx.Lighting")] [h: ''] [h, if(weather != "none" && weather!= "Lightning"): runMacro("emptyOverlay", "fx.Weather", 0)] [h, if(weather_!= "none" && weather_!="Lightning"): runMacro("emptyOverlay", "fx.Weather_", 0)] [h, if(sfx != "none" && sfx != "Gradient Edge") : runMacro("emptyOverlay", "fx.Ambience", 0)] [h, if(sfx_!= "none" && sfx_!= "Gradient Edge") : runMacro("emptyOverlay", "fx.Ambience_", 0)] [h, if(space != "none") : runMacro("emptyOverlay", "fx.Space", 0)] [h, if(space_!= "none") : runMacro("emptyOverlay", "fx.Space_", 0)] [h: ''] [h, if(sfx != "none"), code:{ [args=""] [if(sfx=="Birds"): input("args|1.7,2.2,2.7,3.2,3.6,4.1|Bird size|radio|SELECT=4 VALUE=STRING")] [if(sfx=="Swarm"): input("args|0.6,0.85,1.05,1.3,1.55,1.8,2.05|Bug size|radio|SELECT=4 VALUE=STRING")] [if(sfx=="Falling Leaves"): input("args|8,12,16,20,24,28|Leaf size|radio|SELECT=3 VALUE=STRING")] [runMacro(sfx, args)] }] [h, if(sfx_!= "none"), code:{ [args=""] [if(sfx_=="Birds"): input("args|1.7,2.2,2.7,3.2,3.6,4.1|Bird size|radio|SELECT=4 VALUE=STRING")] [if(sfx_=="Swarm"): input("args|0.6,0.85,1.05,1.3,1.55,1.8,2.05|Bug size|radio|SELECT=4 VALUE=STRING")] [if(sfx_=="Falling Leaves"): input("args|8,12,16,20,24,28|Leaf size|radio|SELECT=3 VALUE=STRING")] [runMacro(sfx_, args)] }] [h, if(weather != "none"): runMacro(weather, args)] [h, if(weather_!= "none"): runMacro(weather_,args)] [h, if(space != "none"): runMacro(space, args)] [h, if(space_ != "none"): runMacro(space_, args)] [h, if(sound != "none"): runMacro(sound, args)]

macros.label: emptyOverlay
macros.command:
[h:name = arg(0)]
[overlay(name, "zorder=-1"): {
<script>
[r:'


']
</script>
}]

[h:closeOverlay(name)]

macros.label: runMacro
macros.command:
[h: abort(argCount())]
[h: macroName = arg(0)]
[h, if(argCount()>1): args=arg(1); args=""]
[h, if(argCount()>2): runWhen=arg(2); runWhen=1]
[h: macroToRun = macroLinkText(macroName + "@" + getMacroLocation(),"none", args)]
[h: execLink(macroToRun, runWhen, "all")]
macros.tooltip:
Executes the specified macro on all clients.
Usage: runMacro("macro name" [optional: , "macro arguments"][, boolean Run immediately])
